extracted_rules.rule: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Standard Lot with Low Roof Slope
extracted_rules.ambiguities: The definition of a 'standard lot' is not provided on this page. The base elevation from which height is measured (e.g., 'average grade') is not explicitly defined, though implied by the 'Height & grade' heading.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'standard lot' where the roof slope is less than 12:12.

Variables.roof_slope: The vertical rise in inches for every 12 inches of horizontal run. For this rule, the value must be less than 12:12.

Constants.height_measurement_point: Measured to top of roof material (as per Figure 42 caption).
Constants.roof_slope_definition: Vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (run), expressed as rise:run (as per Figure 43).

Conditions.Mandatory: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (structure_type == 'Main dwelling' AND lot_type == 'standard lot' AND roof_slope < 12:12) THEN max_height = 30'.
Conditions.Dependencies: Maximum height is dependent on structure_type, lot_type, and roof_slope.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is one of several height regulations under the 'Height' category.
Relationships.Cross-references: Code Section 18.12.040 (a) Table 2; Code Section 18.04.030 (64) (b); Figure 42; Figure 43.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for main dwellings on standard lots with roof slopes ≥ 12:12.

extracted_rules.rule: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Standard Lot with High Roof Slope
extracted_rules.ambiguities: The definition of a 'standard lot' is not provided on this page. The base elevation from which height is measured (e.g., 'average grade') is not explicitly defined, though implied by the 'Height & grade' heading.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'standard lot' where the roof slope is greater than or equal to 12:12.

Variables.roof_slope: The vertical rise in inches for every 12 inches of horizontal run. For this rule, the value must be greater than or equal to 12:12.

Constants.height_measurement_point: Measured to top of roof material (as per Figure 42 caption).
Constants.roof_slope_definition: Vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (run), expressed as rise:run (as per Figure 43).

Conditions.Mandatory: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (structure_type == 'Main dwelling' AND lot_type == 'standard lot' AND roof_slope >= 12:12) THEN max_height = 33'.
Conditions.Dependencies: Maximum height is dependent on structure_type, lot_type, and roof_slope.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is one of several height regulations under the 'Height' category.
Relationships.Cross-references: Code Section 18.12.040 (a) Table 2; Code Section 18.04.030 (64) (b); Figure 42; Figure 43.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with the rule for main dwellings on standard lots with roof slopes < 12:12.

extracted_rules.rule: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Substandard or Flag Lot
extracted_rules.ambiguities: The definitions of 'substandard lot' and 'flag lot' are not provided on this page. The base elevation from which height is measured is not explicitly defined.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'substandard' or 'flag' lot.

Constants.height_measurement_point: Measured to top of roof material (inferred from other rules and Figure 42).

Conditions.Mandatory: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (structure_type == 'Main dwelling' AND (lot_type == 'substandard lot' OR lot_type == 'flag lot')) THEN max_height = 17'.
Conditions.Dependencies: Maximum height is dependent on structure_type and lot_type. It is not dependent on roof slope.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is one of several height regulations under the 'Height' category.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Shares the same height limit as '2nd-dwelling units'.

extracted_rules.rule: Max Height for Accessory Structure in Yard
extracted_rules.ambiguities: The definitions of 'rear yard' and 'side yard' are not provided on this page. The base elevation from which height is measured is not explicitly defined.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to an 'Accessory structure' located in a 'rear' or 'side' yard.

Constants.height_measurement_point: Measured to top of roof material (inferred from other rules and Figure 42).

Conditions.Mandatory: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (structure_type == 'Accessory structure' AND (structure_location == 'rear yard' OR structure_location == 'side yard')) THEN max_height = 12'.
Conditions.Dependencies: Maximum height is dependent on structure_type and structure_location.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is one of several height regulations under the 'Height' category.

extracted_rules.ambiguities: The specific definition of a '2nd-dwelling unit' is not provided on this page. The base elevation from which height is measured is not explicitly defined.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.

Constants.height_measurement_point: Measured to top of roof material (inferred from other rules and Figure 42).

Conditions.Mandatory: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.
Conditions.Dependencies: Maximum height is dependent on structure_type.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is one of several height regulations under the 'Height' category.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Shares the same height limit as a 'Main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot'.
